description.db:para: This table is used by the Emergency module to save information associated with a emergency call, for trouble shooting purposes. More information can be found at: &OPENSIPS_MOD_DOC;emergency.html.

column.name: callid
column.description: header that uniquely identifies the call.

column.name: selectiveRoutingID
column.description: The Common Language Location Indicator(CLLI) code associated with the Selective Router to which the emergency call is to be directed

column.name: routingESN
column.description: The Emergency Services Number associated with a particular ESZ that respresents a unique combination of Police, Fire and EMS emergency responders.

column.name: npa
column.description: The primary Numbering Plan Area (NPA) associated with the outgoing route to the Selective Router that is appropriate for caller's location.

column.name: esgwri
column.description: Routing information used to direct the call to the ESGW.

column.name: lro
column.description: last routing option destination for the call.

column.name: VPC_organizationName
column.description: company name or other label of the VPC that provided the routing information.

column.name: VPC_hostname
column.description: identifies the fully qualified domain name or IP address of the VPC that provided routing information.

column.name: VPC_timestamp
column.description: Date Time Stamp indicating UTC date and time that the message was sent from VPC.

column.name: result
column.description: Code indicating the reason for success or failure to determine an ERT/ESGWRI and ESQK.

column.name: disposition
column.description: Describe how routing of call was done(e.g.,by ESGWRI or bye LRO)
